title: Inside squalid home from hell where tenants lived with no electricity or hot water
text:

A rogue landlord let tenants live in a disgusting house from hell which had no electricity, heating or even a shower.

Mountains of rubbish were piled up in both the front and back gardens while the bathroom had a filthy toilet and no shower.

The property in Cambridge also had no cooking facilities, no hot water, no working kitchen sink and inadequate fire safety precautions.

Photos taken by Cambridge City Council shed light on the grim living conditions of the home which had four people living in.

An investigation was launched after the tenants complained and the landlord was find almost £2,500.

Landlord, Noelle Salameh, 33, of Cambridge, was sent a schedule of work to resolve the problems but subsequent inspections showed no improvement.

(Image: Cambridge City Council/ SWNS.com)

Ms Salameh, a midwife, was then served a formal Improvement Notice to compel her to comply with the law but, once again, inspections showed little meaningful improvement.

Her case was taken by the council to Cambridge Magistrates' Court on Thursday, September 19.

The court heard how Ms Salameh had ignored requests from tenants to be provided with heating, hot water and functioning fire alarms.

Evidence was also heard that Ms Salameh had previously allowed more tenants to live in the property than could be safely accommodated.

She leaded guilty to the offences in person and was fined a total of £2,478 with £1,370 costs and £108 victim surcharge.

(Image: Cambridge City Council/ SWNS.com)

Cllr Richard Johnson, executive councillor for housing, said: “Nobody renting a home should be subjected to these shocking conditions.

“We are determined to take a tough line with rogue landlords who exploit their tenants for personal gain.

“As this case shows, we will not hesitate to take legal action if landlords refuse to abide by their legal obligations to their tenants.

“We will continue to do all we can to protect residents from poor housing conditions and I hope that this case serves as another warning to the small minority of landlords who continue to flout the law.”
description: Landlord Noelle Salameh, 33, was taken to court and fined over the lack of facilities at the property in Cambridge
